title: OPEC, Allies Near Agreement for Small Production Increase
sub_head: Boost of no more than 500,000 barrels a day starting next month is a compromise between Saudi Arabia and Russia
body:
The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies are closing in on an agreement to modestly boost their collective oil output by as much as 500,000 barrels a day starting next month, people familiar with the matter said.
The agreement would mark a compromise among some of the worldâ€™s biggest producers as they meet later Thursday to formalize a deal.
Write to Benoit Faucon at benoit.faucon@wsj.com and Summer Said at summer.said@wsj.com
